description: 6 Lead Archetypes (Voice Leads) - Single Source of Truth for the Universal Brand System

core_principle.axiom: Lead = Emotional Gatekeeper. 80% of impact comes from first 20% of copy (Pareto).
core_principle.sequence: Emotional preference → Logical rationalization. Hook emotionally first, justify logically second.

archetypes.name: Offer Lead
archetypes.best_for: Most Aware prospects ready to buy (AWARE_MOST)

example.text: May I send you 3 FREE Issues of The Economist? Over 2.5 million educated professionals trust The Economist for global insight...
example.mechanics: Status + elite readership → +29% response via prestige

archetypes.when_to_use: Audience knows product, wants it, needs reason to act now

archetypes.name: Promise Lead
archetypes.best_for: Product/Solution Aware prospects evaluating options (AWARE_PRODUCT, AWARE_SOLUTION)

example.text: How to Win Friends and Influence People
example.mechanics: Rockefeller quote ties to LF8_SUPERIORITY → +influence desire

archetypes.when_to_use: Audience knows category, comparing options, wants proof of superiority

archetypes.name: Problem-Solution Lead
archetypes.best_for: Solution/Problem Aware prospects feeling pain (AWARE_SOLUTION, AWARE_PROBLEM)

sub_types.pattern: If you struggle with X, then...
What if X wasn't the problem?
Stop doing X. Start doing Y.

example.text: Do You Make These Mistakes in English?

archetypes.when_to_use: Audience feels pain but hasn't identified your solution yet

archetypes.name: Secret Lead
archetypes.best_for: Problem/Unaware prospects needing curiosity hook (AWARE_PROBLEM, AWARE_UNAWARE)

techniques.neologizing: Invent new term for known concept

example.text: The Royalty Program: How ordinary investors collect 'royalty checks' every month...

archetypes.when_to_use: Audience needs curiosity to engage; direct approach would be rejected

archetypes.name: Proclamation Lead

example.text: Read This Or Die: According to Johns Hopkins, 95% of adults have these 3 conditions—and most don't know it...

archetypes.when_to_use: Audience has no awareness; need pattern interrupt to get attention

archetypes.name: Story Lead
archetypes.best_for: Skeptical/Unaware prospects with resistance (AWARE_UNAWARE + high skepticism)

example.text: On a beautiful late spring afternoon, twenty-five years ago, two young men graduated from the same college. They were very much alike...
example.mechanics: Equal start → divergent ends → 'What made the difference?' → vicarious LF8_SUPERIORITY desire

archetypes.when_to_use: Audience is skeptical or resistant to selling; story bypasses defenses

directness_spectrum.description: All 6 leads arranged from most direct to most indirect
directness_spectrum.principle: As awareness decreases, directness must also decrease

usage_rules.reference_by: Use semantic ID (e.g., LEAD_STORY) not position in all documents
usage_rules.selection_protocol: 1. Identify awareness level → 2. Check directness spectrum → 3. Select matching lead
usage_rules.mismatch_warning: Direct lead to unaware audience = rejection. Indirect lead to most-aware = frustration.
usage_rules.testing_note: When uncertain, test adjacent leads on spectrum. Data overrides theory.

terminology_clarification.note: LEAD_ARCHETYPES (this file) = 6 Voice Lead Types for copy structure
terminology_clarification.distinction: BRAND_ARCHETYPES (registry/awareness/brand-archetypes.json) = 4 Character Archetypes for persona (Leader, Adventurer, Reporter, Reluctant Hero)
terminology_clarification.avoid_confusion: Voice Leads = HOW you open copy. Brand Archetypes = WHO you embody across all content.
